title: [Large-scale] Community-Based Medical Career Exploration Simulation: Healthcare Communication and Clinical Environment Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical terminology (symptoms, diagnosis, treatment) and understanding of clinical workflows, essential expression and vocabulary skills for patient interviews (symptom description, medical history taking), and awareness of formal/informal communication differences in healthcare settings
context.additional_context: Compares community healthcare scenarios (patient education, preventive medicine counseling) with hospital simulations (emergency situations, multidisciplinary consultations) in smartphone-based VR environments. Analyzes precise medical language use (terminology, patient communication styles) and context-appropriate expressions (empathetic vs. directive language) required in clinical settings.

learning_goals: Identify and execute at least three professional communication skills required in community-based clinical settings (e.g., patient history-taking, symptom explanation, treatment plan delivery) using medical terminology and context-specific expressions.

Compare and analyze at least three communication methods in hospital and community healthcare settings (e.g., medical protocols, patient-provider interactions, cultural contexts) through VR simulations, reinforcing specialized terminology and logical expression.
Write a one-page career plan reflecting changes in personal career preferences, applying medical field-specific terminology and structured expression formats.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
